body:
Regressions compared to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496 include:
- mousewheel zoom is gone
- mousewheel actor rotation is not working
- cloaked units do not show the cloaked palette (to check the radius of the cloak generator, maybe solves this with range circle)
- low power is not indicated anymore with disabled overlays
- infantry is not doing the idle animation while everything else does
- tooltips don't work neither at the battlefield nor in the selection palettes
- INTERIOR boxes appear on DESERT maps (with a glitchy palette error)
- click drag 1x1 tiles no longer works which e.g. makes painting oceans very annoying.

Improvements I spotted so far:
- Crates appear in the actor palette
- Husk actors appear in the actor palette

Crash when placing `mpspawn` in the ts mod:

```
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.

  at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[TraitPair`1] (IEnumerable`1 e, System.Action`1 a, System.String text) [0x00022] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/WorldUtils.cs:92

> Regressions compared to #4496 include:

These are all intentional changes except for the tooltips, which will be a simple fix.

Edit: the list that was originally posted were all intentional changes, but has since been edited with several new issues.

> - tooltips don't work neither at the battlefield nor in the selection palettes
> - INTERIOR boxes appear on DESERT maps (with a glitchy palette error)
> - click drag 1x1 tiles no longer works which e.g. makes painting oceans very annoying.

and the crash should be fixed again prior to merging. I assume that won't be hard.

> INTERIOR boxes appear on DESERT maps (with a glitchy palette error)

This isn't a regression - the RA mod rules are just sloppy with their editor filtering (this affects more than just boxes on desert).  I have a commit that explores using multiple inheritance to clean up, correct, and drastically reduce the duplicated map decoration rules, but that is outside the scope of this particular PR.

Edit: See [pchote/ra-decoration-cleanup](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/ra-decoration-cleanup)

- Would be nice if D2k's resource layer is drawn under the terrain grid.
- Also it would be very nice if you could bind the zoom to a hotkey. Or even better - to the mouse scroll.
- Would be nice to be able to turn the edge shroud off (without having to add hacks in the shroud code).
- It seems to ignore "thick" spice and only draw regular spice. TD and RA have no problems with different resource types.

Zoom is bound to the zoom hotkey (`.` by default).  I am against binding zoom to the scrollwheel because scroll != zoom and our zoom is in discrete steps, while the scrollwheel / trackpad is continuous.  It would also conflict with the scrolling support that I plan on building eventually.
I also liked the idea to use the scrollwheel to zoom but what about using PageUp and PageDown keys for zooming in and out ?

Just a couple of things while doing some quick testing:
- Exiting and discarding all changes still leaves an orphaned `temp.oramap` behind.
- Loading the desert shellmap crashes with `Exception of type 'System.InvalidOperationException': TypeDictionary does not contain instance of type 'OpenRA.Traits.IQuantizeBodyOrientationInfo'`

> Would be nice if D2k's resource layer is drawn under the terrain grid.

I already fixed it by simply re-ordering the traits. Looks like a recent regression.
Resource rendering is completely different now.
Now depends on #8124 and #8125.
Fixed all the relevant comments.
Middle mouse scrolling does not work in the editor. This regressed a few times in my #4496. You should be able to steal the fix. It is mostly about widget re-ordering, inheritance and splitting.
The tiles still flicker in the TS build palette (see Bridges for example).
Fixed both.
Rebased.

I created some maps on the cnc mod placing some player spawns, tiles and actors for testing, but the game will never show them. Not even on game restart. Don't know what happens. All errors seem to be swallowed.

I tried to open them in the legacy OpenRA.Editor.exe, but that also crashes. Apparently with every map so that could be a regression of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8125.

```

That legacy editor crash is indeed a regression from #8125.  Could you please create a separate issue for that?
Sure. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8142 I am still a bit confused why the ingame map editor seems to create maps that are invisible for the game. The map.yaml looked fine.
That will be a bug that I will need to fix.
Updated to fix the invisible maps and @x-a-n-a-x's cursor glitch.
I can place structures on slopes. Is this intentional?
We didn't want to limit the map authors creativity.

Noticed nothing being broken and no unexpected behaviour.
Works in all mods for me. :+1:

We should test the new Editor against crashes which happens in the old one =(
- Placing tiles outside the map can crash the game... (same problem as in the old one)

![ime-crash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/7601481/f829615e-f916-11e4-81e3-91f80b9392f5.png)
- Choosing a Map size like 2x1 (width x height) can crash the game (same as in the old editor)

other things i found:
- It is able to place more than 8 starting points on the same cell (which can result very badly?) =/

Here's a crash I found when editing a map in TS. To reproduce enable grid mode, place the same cliff tile one tile above the previous like such until it crashes. 

![repro](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/566742/7602990/3427608a-f8e9-11e4-97e1-31a78f4aeb31.png)

Obviously I didn't test enough of the right cases, thanks @cjshmyr and @LipkeGu. Removing my :+1:.
i would suggest, that we try to make the Map editor (as its own) nearest stable ... before merging...
Closes #2939.
